Issues.Title: Visual Studio 2019 Crashing, as soon as RDP Connects
Issues.Body:
Not sure if it only crashes when window is active or not. Also not sure if having Windows Taskbar to the right makes a difference. Using RDP full screen. _This issue has been moved from https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/649452/visual-studio-2019-crashing-as-soon-as-rdp-connect.html VSTS ticketId: 948312_ _These are the original issue comments:_ Visual Studio Feedback System on 7/18/2019, 05:47 PM (5 days ago):

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

 Visual Studio Feedback System on 7/19/2019, 08:56 AM (5 days ago):

This issue is currently being investigated. Our team will get back to you if either more information is needed, a workaround is available, or the issue is resolved.

 Visual Studio Feedback System on 7/19/2019, 08:56 AM (5 days ago):

This feedback is being re-triaged as we are moving it to another team that can better help with the issue. Thanks for your patience.

_These are the original issue solutions:_ (no solutions)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Visual Studio 2019 Crashing, as soon as RDP Connects" (#1360)

Issues.Title: After branching for 5.0, increase the version of WindowsBase to fix incorrect conflict resolution
Issues.Body:
In Core-Setup, we're trying to pack up 3.0 WPF assets to deliver as a 5.0 WindowsDesktop shared framework, and hit problems with WindowsBase.dll versioning: https://gist.github.com/dagood/5f328e6148acd7cc8ee1afcc6c60f814.

Basically, CoreFX produces a 5.0 WindowsBase.dll, which wins against WPF's 4.8 WindowsBase.dll, causing conflict resolution to favor CoreFX's--which isn't supposed to happen.

This is a tracking issue to make sure it's fixed.

/cc @ericstj @vatsan-madhavan
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "After branching for 5.0, increase the version of WindowsBase to fix incorrect conflict resolution" (#1351)

Issues.Title: MAS Accessibility Testing Bugs
Issues.Body:
Catch all Issue to Track MAS-Accessibility bugs for .NET Core 3 Sample Apps. 

List can be found via [AzDO query](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/query/?tempQueryId=0ab38350-4eee-4cbe-9440-bc048b5d6265)


ID | Title
-- | --
947059 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_SolidColorBrush-Animation_Keyboard:   Inactive element receives keyboard focus while navigation.
947071 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_SolidColorBrush-Animation_ScreenReader:   Identical names available for buttons as “Start Animation” in the main   content.
947087 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_SolidColorBrush-Animation_ScreenReader:   Using NVDA the content available in the main content is not announced to the   screen reader users.
947098 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_PredefinedBrushes_ScreenReader:   The "Predefined Brushes" text is not announced as a header element   for the screen reader users.
947717 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_Contents_ScreenReader:   Using narrator the decorative images available for   the"Introduction", "Syntax", etc. are announced as   "image" to the screen reader users.
947720 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_PredefinedBrushes_ScreenReader:   Using NVDA the entire content available in the main window is not announced   to the screen reader users.
947804 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_Contents_ScreenReader:   Inappropriate name announced for the treeview items of the   "Contents" for the screen reader users while navigation.
947810 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_Contents_Keyboard:   While user navigates between the treeview items of the "Contents"   the content within the main window changes.
947814 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_Contents_ScreenReader:   Using narrator the proper role as "treeview item" is not announced   for options of "Contents" for screen reader users.
948205 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_Contents_Keyboard:   The treeview items with toggle button receive keyboard focus twice while   navigating using the arrow key.
948255 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_Contents_ScreenReader:   Using narrator the expand/collapse state not announced for the "Contents"   button for screen reader users.der user.
948316 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_Introduction_ScreenReader:   The informative images present in the main window are not provided with   descriptive text.
948963 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_Contents_AI4D:   (Brushes/button '') The Name property of a focusable element must not be   null.
948970 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_LinearGradient-InteractiveExample_AI4D:   (Brushes/combo box '') The Name property of a focusable element must not be   null.
949047 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_LinearGradient-InteractiveExample_AI4D:   (Brushes/button '') An onscreen element must not have a null   BoundingRectangle property.
949491 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_LinearGradient-InteractiveExample_ScreenReader:   The sliders present in the main window are not actionable using keyboard and   narrator.
949578 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFBrush_LinearGradient-InteractiveExample_ScreenReader:   Using narrator some inappropriate information is announced for the edit field   for the screen reader users.
949765 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPF   Visibility Changes_HighContrast: Screen content is not visible when we apply   High contrast Black theme.
949977 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPF   Text Formatting_HighContrast: Button selection is not visible when we apply   High contrast Black theme.
950655 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_   DataTemplatingIntro_ScreenReader: When control goes on to the information   field using tab key screen reader (nvda + narrator) does not announce   anything.
950658 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_   DataTemplatingIntro_ScreenReader: Screen reader (nvda + narrator ) does not   announce the description, priority text of the 'groceries, laundry, clean,   proposals' fields.
950660 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_   DataTemplatingIntro_ScreenReader: Screen reader (nvda + narrator ) does not   announce the label 'get ready for family reunion' available on the get ready   for family reunion field.
951013 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPF   Message Box_ScreenReader: Screen reader is not announcing Expanded State for   combobox.
951016 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_AlternatingAppearanceOfItems_ScreenReader:   Screen reader (nvda + narrator) does not announce the list item names.
951069 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPF   Flow Document Properties_Left Pane_HighContrast: Keyboard focus in not   visible in high contrast White theme and Normal mode.
951115 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFUsingElements_ClearControls_Keyboard:   The keybaord users are unable to activate the "Clear Controls"   tabitem using "Enter" key.
951117 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFUsingElements_ClearControls_ScreenReader:   The "UI Element Collection - Methods" text is not announced as a   header element for the screen reader users.
951122 | A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPFandASP.NETCore)_WPFUsingElements_InsertControl_ScreenReader:   Identical names available for multiple buttons in the main content.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MAS Accessibility Testing Bugs" (#1350)

* Windows version: windows 10 1809 17763.437

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
 Create a WPF app via CLI. Build 
```
dotnet new wpf -o vbwpf -lang vb
cd vbwpf
dotnet build 
```

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 Dotnet build failed with error BC2017: could not find library 'Microsoft.VisualBasic.dll'
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33921754/61700175-dac71a00-ad6e-11e9-8055-a7d4872940ce.png)

 **Expected behavior:**
 Build succeeded.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF for VB build failed with error BC2017: could not find library 'Microsoft.VisualBasic.dll'" (#1346)

No
 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

 Virtual machine installation of the new system windows7 x86.
 KB2533623 have been installed successfully.KB2999226 was not installed because I published a separate deployment mode and winform app normal run.
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 Open the app
 **Expected behavior:**
    WpfApp6.exe 
   1.0.0.0 
   5cf6822d

   6.1.7600.16816 
   4dce21ad 
   e0434352 
   00009673 
   cc8 
   01d54136bfe6210b

   feb85420-ad29-11e9-93ff-000c29a6aa83

 I've asked similar questions before, and the latest .NET Core 3.0 version does fix in Windows7 sp1, 
[#443](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/443)
，but Windows7 doesn't

Issues.Title: [Request] Open source C++ projects even if it doen't compile or integrates with C# projects.
Issues.Body:
I want to **learn**:
* How WPF rendering?
* How WPF layout complex text paragraph?

Almost all these underlying implementations are written in native C++ projects, for example, milcore.dll and [Line Services](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/PresentationCore/MS/internal/TextFormatting/LineServices.cs).

To learn these, one don't need a compile-able vcxproj, only the source code is needed.

Put these projects in a downloadable zip file is enough, there is no need to add them to this repo.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Request] Open source C++ projects even if it doen't compile or integrates with C# projects." (#1341)

Issues.Title: WPF Datagrid column merge and data trim
Issues.Body:
* .NET Version: v4.7.2 ( Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`)
* Windows version: windows 10 (1903)
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes/No 

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:** 
 I am developing a windows form with data grid, which pulls data from a database and binds the data to a data grid (The number of rows changes as per a unique id and 5 fixed columns). The problems are

1. Bind two columns and display in a single column.
2. Trim the second column contents after a semi-colon (;) and bind both (1st and 2nd data columns) to data grid
3. Get the total of value of all rows for a column and display in a text field (column is a decimal type)
4. Width of the columns get wider in runtime

 
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 1. Unable to bind both the columns, Fields getting overlaped (attached jpg file: DataGrid.jpg)
 2. Trim not supported. Unbale to bind individual rows

 
 **Expected behavior:**
1. Merging both columns, trimming the second column after the semicolon (;)
2. Getting the total value of all rows in a column
 
 **Minimal repro:**


![DataGrid](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22197822/61681998-82bbf380-ad2d-11e9-81c0-3d67b312eac2.jpg)


[DataGrid.txt](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/3420141/DataGrid.txt)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF Datagrid column merge and data trim" (#1340)

Issues.Title: Window.ShowDialog sometimes blocks several seconds when there is a task frequently update UI
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: Preview5
* Windows version: 版本6.1 (内部版本 7601：Service Pack 1)
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
 I have a Window to display high frequency market data.
I use Dispatcher.InvokeAsync(... , DispatcherPriority.Background) to update the UI.

Sometimes if I click some button to show a dialog window, it will block the whole application with serveral seconds, and after the dialog has shown, everything goes OK.

Others such as ContextMenu, ComboBox works fine.
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 
 **Expected behavior:**
 
 **Minimal repro:**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Window.ShowDialog sometimes blocks several seconds when there is a task frequently update UI " (#1336)

Issues.Title: EditBox doesn't work well standalone
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "EditBox doesn't work well standalone" (#1335)

Issues.Title: Window issue with two monitors when "show window contents while dragging" is disabled
Issues.Body:
@Kryptos-FR commented on [Thu Nov 10 2016](https://github.com/microsoft/WPF-Samples/issues/37)

Hello,

The recent DPI support in WPF (starting with .Net 4.6.2) is really nice. It helped us improve a lot our application.

However when moving a window from a monitor to another with a different DPI, the rendering is broken when the system advanced option *show window contents while dragging* is disabled. This issue can be reproduced with the **PerMonitorDPI** samples of this repository.

![performanceoptions](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3006525/20201642/f6d761d4-a7fc-11e6-8ea7-b828de48a9f0.png)

Here are captures of what is happening:
![100% to 150%](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3006525/20202318/b695ced0-a801-11e6-9da9-dbd1bd707575.png)
*moving from a monitor with 100% scale to another monitor with 150% scale*
![150% to 100%](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3006525/20202322/c44b54dc-a801-11e6-8fd2-ff74a61828a8.png)
*moving from a monitor with 150% scale to another monitor with 100% scale*

Also note that this issue still happen in some cases even if the option *show window contents while dragging* is enabled. When using **Win+Arrows** keyboard shortcut to move the window to another monitor.

I tried to workaround it by forcing WPF to recalculate the layout or even with p/invoke some native Win32 API but it doesn't fix this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Window issue with two monitors when "show window contents while dragging" is disabled" (#1334)

Issues.Title: Remove Test Repo dependency on System.Security.Permissions.dll
Issues.Body: After [this effort](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/241) was completed, we now want to do the same for our internal test repo (test code, infrastructure, etc) in order to be completely rid of System.Security.Permissions.dll.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Remove Test Repo dependency on System.Security.Permissions.dll" (#1333)
